scripts.title: Never Paid Myself
scripts.hook: I've built a quarter-million dollar business and I've never paid myself a single dollar.

scripts.hook: Your hook has 2 seconds to work. And yours isn't working. Here's why.

scripts.hook: How much is one new customer worth to your business?

scripts.title: Fire Your ChatGPT Agency
scripts.hook: If your social media agency is using ChatGPT to write all your scripts ‚Äî fire them. Today.

scripts.title: Script This: Plumber
scripts.hook: Someone told me plumbing is the most boring business to make content for.

scripts.title: Script This: Med Spa
scripts.hook: Med spas spend $5,000 a month on ads. I'm about to write them a script for free that'll outperform all of it.
scripts.topic: Showing how to script fear-based med spa content that sells without selling ‚Äî the client story format.

script.label: HOOK
script.text: Med spas spend $5,000 a month on ads. I'm about to write them a script for free that'll outperform all of it.

script.label: BODY 1
script.text: Here's what every med spa gets wrong with their content. They post before-and-afters with zero context. No story, no emotion, just a side-by-side pic and 'book now.' That doesn't make anyone feel anything.

script.label: REHOOK
script.text: Here's what actually works‚Äî

script.label: BODY 2
script.text:
Hook: 'She almost canceled her appointment because she was terrified of looking fake.'

Body: 'This is Sarah. She wanted Botox for a year but kept scrolling horror stories online. Frozen faces. People who don't look like themselves anymore. So she almost didn't come in. But here's what we told her ‚Äî good Botox doesn't make you look different. It makes you look like you slept 8 hours. Watch her reaction seeing herself for the first time.'

Then you show the reveal. That's it. That's the whole video.

script.label: BODY 3
script.text: You're not selling Botox. You're selling the relief that it won't ruin your face. Every med spa client has that fear. Address the fear, show the outcome, let the emotion do the selling.

script.label: OUTRO
script.text: If you run a med spa and your content isn't doing this ‚Äî your content isn't working. Drop your business in the comments, I'll tell you what to post.

scripts.value: Reveals the psychology behind med spa buying decisions ‚Äî fear vs. desire. Shows the exact content format that works.
scripts.cta: What treatment would YOU want to see scripted? üëá
scripts.caption:
Med spas are spending $5K/month on ads.

I wrote them a script for free that'll outperform all of it.

Most med spa content is before/afters with zero emotion.
No story. Just a photo and 'book now.'

That doesn't sell.

Here's what does:

Address the fear.
Show the outcome.
Let the emotion close it.

Drop your business below ‚Äî I'll tell you what to post. üëá

visuals.text: Open confident, slight smirk ‚Äî you're about to prove a point
When delivering the embedded script, shift energy ‚Äî become the med spa's voice
Text overlay: '$5,000 ads vs. free script' at hook for visual contrast

scripts.title: Script This: Attorney
scripts.hook: Lawyers think they can't go viral. I wrote a personal injury attorney a script in under a minute that would get more leads than a billboard.
scripts.topic: Scripting a PI attorney using the 'expose the threat' format ‚Äî building trust by giving away insider knowledge.

script.label: HOOK
script.text: Lawyers think they can't go viral. I wrote a personal injury attorney a script in under a minute that would get more leads than a billboard.

script.label: BODY 1
script.text: Every PI attorney's content is the same. Guy in a suit pointing at text on screen: 'Were you injured in a car accident? Call us today.' Nobody stops for that. You know why? Because it sounds like every other lawyer. And people don't trust lawyers ‚Äî that's the real problem you need to solve first.

script.label: REHOOK
script.text: So here's the script‚Äî

script.label: BODY 2
script.text:
Hook: 'The insurance company is hoping you don't watch this video.'

Body: 'If you just got in a car accident, the insurance adjuster is going to call you within 48 hours. They're going to sound really nice. They're going to ask how you're feeling. And then they're going to offer you a check. Do NOT take it. That first offer? It's designed to be as low as possible before you realize how bad your injuries actually are. Here's exactly what to say when they call‚Äî'

Then you give them the script. Word for word. Free.

script.label: BODY 3
script.text: You're not saying 'hire me.' You're giving them something they desperately need in a moment of panic. That builds more trust than any billboard ever could. And when they DO need a lawyer? You're the one who helped them when nobody else did.

script.label: OUTRO
script.text: If you're an attorney and your content is just you pointing at text ‚Äî we need to talk. Drop your practice area below and I'll script it.

scripts.value: Shows how attorneys can build trust through radical transparency ‚Äî giving away insider knowledge builds authority faster than any ad.
scripts.cta: What type of lawyer should I script next? ‚öñÔ∏èüëá
scripts.caption:
Lawyers think they can't go viral.

I wrote a personal injury attorney a script that gets more leads than a billboard.

Most attorney content: guy in a suit, pointing at text, 'call us today.'

Nobody stops for that.

Here's what actually works:

Give people something they desperately need ‚Äî before they need you.

That's the content strategy.

Drop your practice area below ‚Äî I'll script it. ‚öñÔ∏è

visuals.text: Direct, intense energy at camera ‚Äî you're making a bold claim
When delivering the embedded script, shift energy to match the urgency of the warning
Text overlay: 'More leads than a billboard' at hook

scripts.title: The Script Template
scripts.hook: I'm about to give you the exact script template I use for every single client. Screenshot this.
scripts.topic: Giving away the 5-line fill-in-the-blank script template ‚Äî the highest save-bait content possible.

script.label: HOOK
script.text: I'm about to give you the exact script template I use for every single client. Screenshot this.

script.label: BODY 1
script.text: Every viral business video follows the same structure. It doesn't matter if you're a dentist, a roofer, or a fitness coach. The framework is the same. And most people overcomplicate it.

script.label: REHOOK
script.text: Here's the template. Ready?

script.label: BODY 2
script.text:
Line one ‚Äî the hook: '[Your customer's biggest fear] is costing you [dollar amount or consequence].'

Line two ‚Äî the problem: 'Most [type of business] try to fix this by [common wrong approach]. But that actually makes it worse because [reason].'

Line three ‚Äî the solution: 'Here's what actually works: [your unique approach in one sentence].'

Line four ‚Äî the proof: 'We did this for [client type] and [specific result with a number].'

Line five ‚Äî the CTA: 'If you want the same thing, [simple next step].'

That's it. Five lines. Fill in the blanks. You have a script.

script.label: BODY 3
script.text: This template works because it follows how people actually make decisions. Fear, problem, solution, proof, action. In that order. Don't rearrange it. Don't add fluff. Just fill in the blanks and hit record.

script.label: OUTRO
script.text: Save this. Use it. If it works ‚Äî and it will ‚Äî come back and tell me.

scripts.value: Gives away the actual tool ‚Äî the fill-in-the-blank script framework used for every CMP client. Highest save potential of any content we've made.
scripts.cta: Save üîñ + tag someone who needs this
scripts.caption:
The exact script template I use for every client.

Fill in the blanks. Hit record.

Line 1 ‚Äî Hook: [Fear] is costing you [consequence]
Line 2 ‚Äî Problem: Most [biz type] try [wrong approach]...
Line 3 ‚Äî Solution: Here's what actually works: [your method]
Line 4 ‚Äî Proof: We did this for [client] and [result]
Line 5 ‚Äî CTA: If you want this, [next step]

That's it. 5 lines.

Save this and use it this week. üîñ

visuals.text: NEEDS text overlays ‚Äî each line appears on screen as he says it. This is the most important visual element.
Generous, teaching energy ‚Äî you're literally giving away the playbook
End with 'Save this' while pointing at screen ‚Äî direct prompt to save

scripts.title: Why Your Content Feels Off
scripts.hook: You're posting consistently, getting decent views, but no one's reaching out. Here's why.
scripts.topic: Diagnosing the most common content strategy mistake ‚Äî making content about yourself instead of your customer's fear.

script.label: HOOK
script.text: You're posting consistently, getting decent views, but no one's reaching out. Here's why.

script.label: BODY 1
script.text: Your content is entertaining but it doesn't position you as the solution to a problem. You've got attention but no direction. People watch, they like, they move on. They never think 'I should hire this person.'

script.label: REHOOK
script.text: And it comes down to one missing piece‚Äî

script.label: BODY 2
script.text:
Every piece of content needs to answer one question for the viewer: 'What do I do next?' Not with a 'link in bio' or 'DM me.' With value so specific that they think 'this person clearly knows my problem better than I do.'

When a roofer posts 'We do great roofs!' that's nice. When a roofer posts 'Your roof is leaking in a spot you can't see ‚Äî here's how to check in 30 seconds' ‚Äî now they're the expert. Now there's a reason to call THEM.

script.label: BODY 3
script.text: Stop making content about what you do. Start making content about what your customer is afraid of. That's the shift.

script.label: OUTRO
script.text: If you're posting and not getting leads ‚Äî the content isn't broken. The strategy is.

scripts.value: Diagnoses the exact frustration most business owners feel ‚Äî posting without results. Names the real cause and gives the fix in one sentence.
scripts.cta: What's your business? I'll tell you what to post üëá
scripts.caption:
You're posting. Getting views. Nobody's reaching out.

Here's the actual problem:

Your content is entertaining. It's not positioning.

People watch, they like, they scroll.
They never think 'I need to hire this person.'

The fix:

Stop making content about what YOU do.
Start making content about what your customer is AFRAID of.

That one shift changes everything.

What's your business? Tell me below ‚Äî I'll tell you what to post. üëá

visuals.text: Calm, diagnostic energy ‚Äî you're identifying a problem they've felt but couldn't name
Text overlay on roofer example: 'We do great roofs' ‚ùå vs. 'Leak you can't see' ‚úÖ
End with the principle on screen: 'Content about THEIR fear ‚Üí not YOUR service'

scripts.title: I'll Script Your Business in 60 Seconds
scripts.hook: Comment your business and I'll write you a viral script in 60 seconds. Let's go.
scripts.topic: Interactive challenge ‚Äî script a business live on camera using the CMP framework. Drives comment engagement.

script.label: HOOK
script.text: Comment your business and I'll write you a viral script in 60 seconds. Let's go.

script.label: BODY 1
script.text:
Alright ‚Äî someone said they're a personal trainer. Let's go.

Most fitness content is 'here's a workout.' Cool. Everyone does that. Nobody hires a trainer because of a workout video. They hire because they're STUCK.

script.label: REHOOK
script.text: Here's the script‚Äî

script.label: BODY 2
script.text:
Hook: 'You've been working out for 6 months and you look exactly the same. Here's what's actually wrong.'

Body: 'It's not your effort. You're showing up, you're sweating, you're sore the next day. The problem is your program has no structure. You're doing random workouts from Instagram and expecting a specific result. That's like driving without a GPS and wondering why you're lost. Here's the 3 things you need to fix this week‚Äî'

Then you give three specific, actionable tips. Not generic. Specific.

script.label: BODY 3
script.text: See what I did? I didn't start with the solution. I started with the frustration. Because that's what makes someone stop scrolling. They see their own problem reflected back at them. THEN they're ready to hear the answer.

script.label: OUTRO
script.text: Drop your business in the comments. I'll script the next one live.

scripts.value: Interactive format that drives massive comment engagement ‚Äî turns viewers into participants and proves scripting ability live.
scripts.cta: Drop your business üëá I'll script it
scripts.caption:
Comment your business ‚Äî I'll write you a viral script in 60 seconds.

I picked: Personal Trainer.

Fitness content mistake: showing workouts.
Nobody hires a trainer for a workout video.
They hire because they're STUCK.

So you start with the frustration.
Not the solution.

That's the shift that changes everything.

Drop your business below ‚Äî I'll script the next one. üëá

visuals.text: Playful, fast energy ‚Äî this is a challenge, not a lecture
Pretend to read a comment on phone before scripting ‚Äî adds authenticity
Optional: countdown timer graphic showing '60 seconds' at the start

scripts.title: The Vanity Metric Trap
scripts.hook: If your content is getting 10,000 views and you still have no clients ‚Äî it's not the algorithm. You're measuring the wrong thing.
scripts.topic: Exposing vanity metrics (views) vs. conversion metrics (saves, shares) ‚Äî the real scorecard for business content.

script.label: HOOK
script.text: If your content is getting 10,000 views and you still have no clients ‚Äî it's not the algorithm. You're measuring the wrong thing.

script.label: BODY 1
script.text: You're watching views go up. Followers ticking. Telling yourself it's working. But your DMs are empty. Your phone isn't ringing. You're measuring vanity metrics. And vanity metrics pay nobody's bills.

script.label: REHOOK
script.text: Here's the thing most content coaches will never say to your face...

script.label: BODY 2
script.text:
Views are the audience's glance. Saves are their receipt. Shares are their referral. Those three ‚Äî saves, shares, comments asking questions ‚Äî that's your actual conversion funnel.

A post with 200 views and 4 saves will get you more clients than a post with 10K views and zero saves. I'd put money on it. Because saves mean: I need this. Shares mean: my friend needs this too. That's buyer behavior.

script.label: BODY 3
script.text: Stop asking how many people saw it. Start asking: did it make someone stop, save it, and think 'I need this person?' That is the metric that matters.

script.label: OUTRO
script.text: If you're posting content without tracking saves and shares ‚Äî start today. That's your real scorecard. Everything else is noise.

scripts.value: Reframes how service business owners measure content success ‚Äî shifts focus from vanity metrics to conversion indicators.
scripts.caption:
Stop chasing views. Start tracking what actually drives clients. üìä

If your content isn't getting saves and shares, it's not converting ‚Äî no matter what the view count says.

Views = glance
Saves = receipt
Shares = referral

That's your real funnel.

Drop a üîñ if you needed to hear this.

visuals.text: Shota tight to camera, eye contact. Text overlay at hook: 'Views ‚â† Clients.'
Mid-script: quick B-roll cut to analytics screen showing high views / low saves
Return to Shota for close. Clean, sharp cuts. No music until outro.

scripts.title: 200 Followers, More Clients Than a 20K Account
scripts.hook: I know creators with 20,000 followers who can't get a client. And a business with 200 followers that's fully booked. Here's the difference.
scripts.topic: Busting the follower count myth ‚Äî targeted, specific content beats broad audiences every time.

script.label: HOOK
script.text: I know creators with 20,000 followers who can't get a client. And a business with 200 followers that's fully booked. Here's the difference.

script.label: BODY 1
script.text: We've been sold a lie. That growth equals revenue. That follower count is the scoreboard. So business owners spend months ‚Äî sometimes years ‚Äî chasing a number. While their competitors with a fraction of the following are booking clients every single week.

script.label: REHOOK
script.text: Here's the thing...

script.label: BODY 2
script.text: Followers are vanity. Trust is currency. The 200-follower account? Every post speaks to one person with one problem. The audience is small ‚Äî but it's the right audience. The 20K account? Broad. Generic. Built for the algorithm, not the buyer. There's a difference between a big crowd and the right room. You don't need to go viral. You need to be undeniable to the right 200 people.

script.label: BODY 3
script.text: Build content for your buyer. Not for the algorithm. Because the algorithm doesn't pay your rent. Your clients do.

script.label: OUTRO
script.text: If you run a business ‚Äî your goal is never 'go viral.' Your goal is 'book clients.' Those are completely different content strategies. And I build the second one.

scripts.value: Gives permission to stop chasing follower count. Reframes the goal from virality to specificity. Massive relief factor for small business owners.
scripts.cta: Build for your buyer. Not the algorithm.
scripts.caption:
I've watched businesses with 200 followers outperform accounts with 20K.

Not because of luck. Because they understood one thing:

Your follower count is not your scorecard. Your booked calendar is. üíº

What's your actual goal with content right now? Drop it below ‚Äî I read every comment.

visuals.text: Shota walking and talking ‚Äî movement adds energy and authenticity (BiP feel)
Optional: quick cut to phone showing a small follower count vs. a full booking calendar
Candid, no teleprompter energy. Natural lighting preferred.

scripts.title: Posting Consistently Is the Worst Advice
scripts.hook: Posting consistently is the worst advice anyone ever gave a business owner. And every marketing guru says it.
scripts.topic: Hot take ‚Äî quality over quantity. One extraordinary post beats 30 mediocre ones.

script.label: HOOK
script.text: Posting consistently is the worst advice anyone ever gave a business owner. And every marketing guru says it.

script.label: BODY 1
script.text: Post every day. Stay consistent. Show up even when you don't feel like it. You've heard it. Most people follow it. And most people are posting garbage on a schedule ‚Äî wondering why nothing's working. Consistency without strategy is just noise with a calendar.

script.label: REHOOK
script.text: Here's the thing...

script.label: BODY 2
script.text: One extraordinary post will outperform thirty mediocre ones. Every single time. One video that stops the scroll ‚Äî says something nobody else has said ‚Äî speaks directly to your buyer ‚Äî that's worth more than a month of daily posts. The algorithm doesn't reward frequency. It rewards engagement. And engagement follows quality, not quantity.

script.label: BODY 3
script.text: Don't post more. Post better. Even if that means once a week. Make that one post so good it earns saves. Shares. DMs. Clients. Because garbage on a schedule is still garbage.

script.label: OUTRO
script.text: So before you stress about posting every day ‚Äî ask yourself one question: Is my content actually good?

scripts.value: Gives exhausted business owners permission to slow down and focus on quality. Validates what they already suspect ‚Äî frequency isn't the answer.
scripts.caption:
Hot take: 'Post consistently' has ruined more small businesses than it's helped.

One great post > 30 average ones.

Fight me in the comments. ‚¨áÔ∏è

visuals.text: Shota slightly leaned in toward camera ‚Äî confrontational, confident energy
Bold graphic text overlay at hook. Fast, punchy cuts for body.
Text callout on screen: 'Consistency without strategy = noise.'

scripts.title: The One-Platform Rule
scripts.hook: Stop trying to be on every platform. There is one that's right for your business. Here's how to know which one.
scripts.topic: Depth over breadth ‚Äî mastering one platform beats mediocrity on five.

script.label: HOOK
script.text: Stop trying to be on every platform. There is one that's right for your business. Here's how to know which one.

script.label: BODY 1
script.text: You're posting on TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, and YouTube. Mediocre results on all of them. Because you're spread too thin. Your content is diluted. Your energy is split. You're playing five games at 50% instead of one game at 100%.

script.label: REHOOK
script.text: Here's the thing...

script.label: BODY 2
script.text: Pick the platform where your buyer already is. B2B services? LinkedIn. Consumer-facing brand? Instagram or TikTok. Education and tutorials? YouTube. Find out where your ideal client is scrolling at 10pm. Go there. Master it. Own it. One platform, completely dominated, will get you more clients than five platforms you half-ass.

script.label: BODY 3
script.text: The goal is not to be everywhere. The goal is to be undeniable somewhere. Depth beats breadth. Always has. Always will.

script.label: OUTRO
script.text: If you want help finding your platform and building a content system around it ‚Äî that's exactly what I do. Link in bio.

scripts.value: Gives clarity and permission to focus. Removes overwhelm. Provides a simple framework to pick the right platform.
scripts.caption:
You don't need to be on every platform. You need to own one. üéØ

Which platform is your main focus right now? Drop it below ‚Äî I'll tell you if it's the right call for your business.

visuals.text: Text overlay cycles through platform logos: TikTok ‚Üí Instagram ‚Üí Facebook ‚Üí LinkedIn ‚Üí YouTube ‚Üí then holds on a single arrow: '‚Üí ONE.'
Shota at desk, authoritative setup. Calm, clear delivery.
Clean, minimal. Feels like a revelation.

scripts.title: Script This: Real Estate Agent
scripts.hook: Realtors are spending thousands on Zillow leads. I'm about to write one a script that brings them in for free.
scripts.topic: Scripting a realtor using the 'expose the secret' format ‚Äî giving buyers insider negotiation knowledge.

script.label: HOOK
script.text: Realtors are spending thousands on Zillow leads. I'm about to write one a script that brings them in for free.

script.label: BODY 1
script.text: Real estate agents are some of the most over-marketed, under-differentiated professionals in any city. They all post the same thing ‚Äî listing photos, sold signs, and market updates nobody asked for. Meanwhile, their buyers and sellers are on Instagram asking questions that nobody is answering.

script.label: REHOOK
script.text: Here's the thing...

script.label: BODY 2
script.text:
Here's the script. Hook: 'Your real estate agent is lying to you ‚Äî and it's costing you $30,000.'

Body: 'Most buyers don't negotiate because their agent doesn't want the deal to fall through. So they push you to accept the first counter. I'm going to tell you exactly how to negotiate closing costs, inspection credits, and the final price ‚Äî so you keep that money in your pocket.'

CTA: 'Comment NEGOTIATE and I'll send you my buyer negotiation script.'

That post gets saved. That post gets shared. That post books showings. Not a Zillow ad. A 60-second video.

script.label: BODY 3
script.text: That's what content can do when it gives people something they actually needed to know. Not a sold sign. Not a market update. A secret they didn't know they were missing.

script.label: OUTRO
script.text: If you're a realtor and you want a full content system built around your market ‚Äî link's in bio. And comment your industry below ‚Äî you might be next.

scripts.value: Shows realtors (and their potential clients) how expert knowledge + content beats paid ads. Demonstrates the 'expose the secret' format in real estate.
scripts.cta: Content that earns trust ‚Üí books clients.
scripts.caption:
Real estate agents: stop posting sold signs. Start posting answers to the questions your buyers are Googling at 11pm. üè†

Which industry do you want me to script next? Drop it below ‚Äî I read every one.

visuals.text: Shota delivers the embedded script in character ‚Äî becomes the realtor's voice, then snaps back to himself
The embedded script text appears on screen as he speaks it
Fast cuts during the embedded script. Return to calm, confident Shota for outro.

scripts.title: The AI Content Test
scripts.hook: There's a 3-second test that instantly tells me if content was written by AI. Most business owners are failing it right now.
scripts.topic: Exposing AI-generated content patterns vs. authentic human voice ‚Äî a simple 3-second test any business owner can run on their own posts.

script.label: HOOK
script.text: There's a 3-second test that instantly tells me if content was written by AI. Most business owners are failing it right now.

script.label: BODY 1
script.text: The test is simple. Read the first sentence of your last post out loud. Does it sound like something you'd actually say to a client sitting across from you? Or does it sound like a LinkedIn post from 2019? AI writes in patterns. It uses phrases like 'in today's fast-paced world' and 'it's important to note that' and 'leverage your unique value proposition.' None of that sounds human. All of it kills trust instantly.

script.label: REHOOK
script.text: Here's the thing...

script.label: BODY 2
script.text: The problem isn't that AI writes bad content. The problem is AI writes content that sounds like every other business in your category. And when you sound like everyone else ‚Äî you disappear. Your actual speaking voice is the differentiator. Quick fix: Record yourself answering one client question out loud. Transcribe it. That's your script. Messy, human, real. That's what works.

script.label: BODY 3
script.text: The businesses winning right now aren't the ones with the biggest budgets. They're the ones who sound like a person. That's it. That's the whole game.

script.label: OUTRO
script.text: Run your last 3 posts through this test right now. Read them out loud. If you'd never say it to a client's face ‚Äî rewrite it. If you want help building a content voice that actually sounds like you? That's exactly what we do at CMP. Link's in bio.

scripts.value: Gives business owners a tangible, instant diagnostic for their AI-generated content problem. Positions authentic voice as the competitive advantage. Drives saves + shares from people who recognize the problem.
scripts.cta: Write how you TALK. Not how AI thinks you sound.
scripts.caption:
There's a 3-second test that tells me if content was written by AI.

Most businesses are failing it.

The test: read your last post out loud.
Does it sound like you talking to a client?
Or does it sound like a LinkedIn post from 2019?

AI writes in patterns.
'In today's fast-paced world...'
'Leverage your unique value proposition...'
'It's important to note that...'

None of that sounds human.
All of it kills trust.

Fix: record yourself answering a client question out loud.
Transcribe it.
That's your script.

Run your last 3 posts through this test right now. üëá

visuals.text: Open close to camera, confident ‚Äî you've spotted something most people miss
Text overlay at hook: '3-second AI test' ‚Äî let it land before explaining
When listing AI phrases, deliver in slightly flat/robotic tone to contrast with your natural voice
End with the fix on screen: 'Record ‚Üí Transcribe ‚Üí Post'

scripts.title: Going Viral Is the Most Expensive Way to Get Zero Clients
scripts.hook: Going viral is the most expensive way to get zero clients. I'm done pretending otherwise.
scripts.topic: Contrarian take: chasing virality is the wrong goal for service businesses ‚Äî trust-building content for a targeted audience beats broad reach every time.

script.label: HOOK
script.text: Going viral is the most expensive way to get zero clients. I'm done pretending otherwise.

script.label: BODY 1
script.text: Everyone's chasing reach. Big numbers. Watch counts. And I get it ‚Äî a viral video feels like winning. For a day. But viral content is built to talk to everyone. Which means it talks to no one who will actually hire you. The local business owner with 500 followers who posts specific, targeted content about their customer's exact problem? Booking clients every week. The guy with a viral post and 10,000 new followers? Not one of them is in his market.

script.label: REHOOK
script.text: Here's the thing...

script.label: BODY 2
script.text: Viral is built for audiences. Clients are built on trust. Those are two completely different content strategies. Trust content says: 'I understand your exact problem. I've solved it before. Here's proof.' Viral content says: 'Look at me.' One of those sentences leads to a sales conversation. The other gets a like and a scroll.

script.label: BODY 3
script.text: Stop optimizing for reach. Start optimizing for the right 50 people seeing your post and thinking ‚Äî 'I need to call this person.' That's the only metric that pays your rent.

script.label: OUTRO
script.text: The goal isn't to go viral. The goal is to be unavoidable to the people who need what you do. One is ego. The other is a business. Drop a comment if you've been chasing the wrong number.

scripts.value: Gives exhausted, confused business owners permission to stop chasing vanity. Reframes the entire content goal. Highly shareable ‚Äî business owners will send this to their partners, marketers, and social media managers.
scripts.caption:
Hot take: going viral is the most expensive way to get zero clients.

Viral content talks to everyone.
Which means it talks to no one who will actually hire you.

Trust content says:
'I understand your problem. I've solved it. Here's proof.'

Viral content says:
'Look at me.'

One leads to a sales call.
The other gets a like and a scroll.

Stop optimizing for reach.
Start optimizing for the right 50 people thinking 'I need to call this person.'

Fight me in the comments. ‚¨áÔ∏è

visuals.text: Shota slightly leaned in ‚Äî calm, not angry, just done with the narrative
Text overlay at hook: 'Going viral = zero clients?' ‚Äî let the question hang
Fast cuts in BODY when listing what each content type 'says' ‚Äî punch the contrast
Call for comments explicitly in outro ‚Äî this hot take will generate debate

scripts.title: The First Client I Landed With Content
scripts.hook: The first client I ever landed from Instagram content was from a video I almost didn't post.
scripts.topic: First-person story of landing the first paying client through organic content ‚Äî proving the system works, giving permission to post the 'obvious' thing.

script.label: HOOK
script.text: The first client I ever landed from Instagram content was from a video I almost didn't post.

script.label: BODY 1
script.text: It was a reel I filmed on my phone in my apartment. No set. No production. Just me talking about why most service businesses sound exactly the same on social media ‚Äî and why that's quietly killing their leads. I almost didn't post it. I thought it was too basic. Too obvious. Like ‚Äî who doesn't already know this?

script.label: REHOOK
script.text: Here's the thing...

script.label: BODY 2
script.text: I posted it anyway. Three days later, I got a DM from a business owner in Detroit. He said: 'You described my exact problem word for word. I didn't even know that was why my content wasn't working until I watched your video.' We had a call that week. He signed. And that taught me the most important lesson I know about content: obvious to you is not obvious to them. The stuff you think everyone already knows? That's exactly what someone is desperate to hear explained out loud.

script.label: BODY 3
script.text: The post doesn't need to be complex. It doesn't need high production. It just needs to be true. Specific. And spoken directly at the one person who needed to hear it today.

script.label: OUTRO
script.text: That first client? He's still a client. And it started with a video I almost deleted. If you've got something sitting in your drafts that you're second-guessing ‚Äî post it. Someone needs it more than you think.

scripts.value: Emotional proof-of-concept story that gives permission to post imperfect content. Shows the exact mechanism (DM ‚Üí call ‚Üí close) that content can drive. Relief factor: you don't need a polished video to land a client.
scripts.cta: Post the 'obvious' thing. Someone needs it.
scripts.caption:
The first client I landed from Instagram was from a video I almost didn't post.

I filmed it on my phone.
No set. No production.
Just me talking about why most service businesses sound exactly the same ‚Äî and why it's hurting their leads.

I thought it was too basic. Too obvious.

Then I got a DM from a business owner in Detroit:
'You described my exact problem word for word.'

We had a call that week. He signed. He's still a client.

Lesson:
Obvious to you ‚â† obvious to them.

The thing you think everyone already knows?
Someone out there desperately needs to hear you say it.

Post the obvious thing. üì§

visuals.text: Walking-and-talking OR seated with natural lighting ‚Äî Build in Public, not polished
Consider showing phone screen briefly while describing filming in apartment
When delivering client DM quote, slow down ‚Äî that's the emotional core
Keep cuts natural, not rapid ‚Äî this is a story, not a list

scripts.title: Script This: HVAC
scripts.hook: Someone told me HVAC is the most boring business to make content about. I wrote them a script in 60 seconds that got more leads than their Google Ads.
scripts.topic: Scripting a trades/HVAC business using the 'expose the threat before it's too late' format ‚Äî homeowner fear-based content that earns DMs over Google Ads.

script.label: HOOK
script.text: Someone told me HVAC is the most boring business to make content about. I wrote them a script in 60 seconds that got more leads than their Google Ads.

script.label: BODY 1
script.text: Here's what most HVAC companies post. Before and after of a unit they replaced. 'Serving the Detroit metro area since 1994.' A promo for 10% off this weekend. Nobody stops for that. Nobody shares that. Nobody calls because of that. The problem isn't HVAC content. The problem is they're posting the business instead of the customer's fear.

script.label: REHOOK
script.text: Here's the script I wrote them‚Äî

script.label: BODY 2
script.text:
Hook: 'Your AC is going to fail this summer. Here's how to know before it costs you $4,000.'

Body: 'There are five signs your AC unit is about to die ‚Äî and most homeowners miss all of them until it's 95 degrees outside and they're calling an emergency line at 11pm. Sign one: your energy bill went up 20% or more compared to last year. That means the unit is working twice as hard to do half the job. Sign two: you hear a clicking noise when it first kicks on. That's a dying capacitor. $150 to replace now ‚Äî $3,500 to replace the whole unit when it fails. I'll show you the other three‚Äî'

Then you cut. They DM you. Every time.

script.label: BODY 3
script.text: You're not making HVAC content. You're making content about a homeowner's worst summer nightmare. Address that fear. Then position yourself as the person who could've prevented it. Any business can do this. You just have to find the fear first.

script.label: OUTRO
script.text: Drop your business below. I'll tell you the fear your customer has that you should be scripting to. And if you're in HVAC ‚Äî this script is yours. Hit record.

scripts.value: Extends the beloved Script This series to the trades/contractor market. Shows fear-based content works for any business category. High save/share potential from business owners in trades who feel their industry is 'unscriptable.'
scripts.cta: Find the fear. That's the content.
scripts.caption:
'HVAC is too boring to make content about.'

I wrote them a script in 60 seconds.
It got more leads than their Google Ads.

Most HVAC content: before/afters, promotions, service area.
Nobody stops for that.

The fix:
Stop posting about the business.
Start posting about the customer's fear.

Fear: 'My AC is going to die in July and I won't see it coming.'

That's the hook. That's the script.
And it books calls. üîß

Drop your business below ‚Äî I'll write yours. üëá

visuals.text: Open with slight smirk ‚Äî you're proving a point, not lecturing
When delivering embedded HVAC script, shift energy ‚Äî more urgent/warning tone
Text overlay during script: show 'Sign 1' and 'Sign 2' on screen as he speaks
Snap back to Shota's natural voice for BODY 3 and OUTRO

scripts.title: What I'd Do If I Started From Zero Today
scripts.hook: If I deleted my Instagram today and started completely from zero ‚Äî here's exactly what I'd post for the first 30 days.
scripts.topic: Tactical 30-day content roadmap for starting from zero ‚Äî proof of thinking, proof of process, one case study. Removes overwhelm, creates a clear path.

script.label: HOOK
script.text: If I deleted my Instagram today and started completely from zero ‚Äî here's exactly what I'd post for the first 30 days.

script.label: BODY 1
script.text: Most people starting out do the same thing. They post everything at once ‚Äî tips, behind the scenes, random opinions, reposted quotes. No direction. No coherent story. The account never gets traction because nobody watching can figure out: who is this person, and why should I care? So if I had to start over ‚Äî one account, zero followers, no portfolio ‚Äî here are the only three types of content I'd post in the first 30 days.

script.label: REHOOK
script.text: This is the actual playbook‚Äî

script.label: BODY 2
script.text:
Weeks 1 and 2: Proof of Thinking. No case studies needed. No clients needed. Just show you understand the problem better than anyone else. One post per day answering the question your ideal client is Googling at midnight. Prove your brain before you prove your results.

Week 3: Proof of Process. Show how you actually work. The framework. The system. Not the results yet ‚Äî the methodology. Let them see how you think so they can imagine working with you.

Week 4: One Case Study. Doesn't have to be a massive client. Could be a friend's business you helped for free. Show the before. The decision. The after. Make it specific. Make it real.

By day 30? Twelve pieces of content that prove three things: you understand the problem, you have a system, and it actually works. That's enough to close a client.

script.label: BODY 3
script.text: You don't need more followers to get clients. You need better proof. Those first 30 days aren't about going viral. They're about building a body of work that earns trust with the right person when they land on your page.

script.label: OUTRO
script.text: This is exactly the content system I build for every new client account at CMP. If you want it built for your business ‚Äî link's in bio. And if you're starting from zero right now ‚Äî save this. This is your roadmap.

scripts.value: Highest save-bait potential in batch 004. Gives any business owner a clear, specific action plan they can screenshot and follow. Removes the #1 barrier (overwhelm/not knowing where to start). Also positions CMP as the builder of this system.
scripts.caption:
If I deleted my Instagram today and started from zero ‚Äî here's what I'd post for 30 days.

Week 1-2: Proof of Thinking
‚Üí Answer the question your client Googles at midnight
‚Üí Every. Single. Day.

Week 3: Proof of Process
‚Üí Show your framework, your system, how you think
‚Üí Let them imagine working with you

Week 4: One case study
‚Üí Real. Specific. Numbers if possible.

By day 30:
12 posts. Proof you understand the problem. Proof you have a system. Proof it works.

That's enough to close a client.

Save this üîñ ‚Äî it's your roadmap.

visuals.text: Sitting down, relaxed ‚Äî Build in Public, personal, like a conversation with a friend
Text overlays CRITICAL ‚Äî each week's content type appears on screen as he names it
Optional: simple calendar graphic showing the 30-day breakdown
Each content type gets a clear on-screen label: 'Proof of Thinking,' 'Proof of Process,' 'Case Study'
